canonical.name: Lu
canonical.title: 56. Lu / The Traveler
canonical.judgment: Lu intimates that in the condition which it denotes there may be some little attainment and progress. If the stranger or traveller be firm and correct as they ought to be, there will be good fortune.
canonical.image: The trigram representing a mountain, and above it that for fire, form Lu. The superior person, in accordance with this, exerts their wisdom and caution in the use of punishments and in not allowing litigations to continue.

1.text: shows the stranger mean and meanly occupied. It is thus that they bring on themselves further calamity.

2.text: shows the stranger, occupying their lodging-house, carrying with them their means of livelihood, and provided with good and trusty servants.

3.text: shows the stranger burning their lodging-house, and having lost their servants. However firm and correct they try to be, they will be in peril.

4.text: shows the traveller in a resting-place, having also the means of livelihood and the axe, but still saying, ' I am not at ease in my mind.'

5.text: shows its subject shooting a pheasant. They will lose their arrow, but in the end they will obtain praise and a high charge.

6.text: suggests the idea of a bird burning its nest. The stranger, thus represented, first laughs and then cries out. They have lost their ox-like docility too readily and easily. There will be evil.

metadata.notes: Original translation preserved from pyChing v1.2.2
